info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 18 at 12:23AM CDT until June 18 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LITTLE RIVER...NORTHWESTERN SEVIER...MCCURTAIN... NORTHWESTERN BOWIE AND RED RIVER COUNTIES... At 1223 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Whitesboro to 7 miles east of Arthur City, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... De Queen, Clarksville, Horatio, Foreman, Boxelder, Idabel, Broken Bow, De Kalb, Bogata, Gillham, Arkinda, Bagwell, Manchester, Wright City, Valliant, Detroit, Deport, Avery, Millerton and Annona. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
